fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: This question does not address inequality of votes based on class or other criteria but only the relationship between votes and seats. Leave blank if no upper chamber.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Does the electoral system (including the size of electoral districts) involve large differences in the ratios of votes to representatives in elections for the upper chamber?

fxInfo_responses.value: There is a high degree of malapportionment. Vote/seat ratios across districts differ by as much as 50:1.
There is a substantial degree of malapportionment. Vote/seat ratios across districts differ as much as 10:1.
There is some degree of malapportionment. Vote/seat ratios across districts differ by as much as 2:1.
There is modest or no malapportionment. Vote/seat ratios across districts differ by less than 2:1.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
